description:
An almighty voice. With fiery red locks.

The story takes place on an island where Uta, the world’s favorite diva, performs for the first time in public. Uta’s singing voice, which she sings with while concealing her true identity, has been described as “otherworldly,” and while the venue is filled with the Straw Hats led by Luffy, pirates, navy, and fans from all over the world who have come to enjoy her voice, Uta’s voice is heard in a new light. The curtain rises on the story with the shocking revelation that she is “Shanks’ daughter!“

(Source: ONE PIECE FILM RED Website)
synonyms: วันพีซ ฟิล์ม เรด

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Pirates
tags.description: Prominently features sea-faring adventurers branded as criminals by the law.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Musical Theater
tags.description: Features a performance that combines songs, spoken dialogue, acting, and dance.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Augmented Reality
tags.description: Prominently features events with augmented reality as the main setting.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Skeleton
tags.description: Prominently features skeleton(s) as a character.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

node.description: [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/黒岩勉)

Among [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s most noted directors.

Famous directorial works include [Planetes](https://anilist.co/anime/329/), [Scryed](https://anilist.co/anime/168/), [Infinite Ryvius](https://anilist.co/anime/593/) as well as [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/), which is an original story created by him and the series' lead writer [Ichirou Ookouchi](https://anilist.co/staff/98067/). Taniguchi is the one who proposed the idea to the producers at Sunrise. The basic idea for the plot consisted of a "hero" who led a secret organization, which was later developed into a conflict between two characters with different values and who belonged to the same military unit.

__Favorite Animal:__ Big gentle dogs
__Favorite Mangaka:__ [Akira Toriyama](https://anilist.co/staff/96901/Akira-Toriyama)
__Favorite Music:__ '70s soul music
__Favorite Real-Life Pirate:__ Edward Teach (Blackbeard)
__Favorite Video Game:__ Puyo Puyo
__Trivia:__
- Oda is married to Chiaki Inaba, who had played Nami during Jump Festa One Piece stage performances.
- In a recent Japanese fan poll, Oda is currently ranked the 48th Most Popular Character in [One Piece](https://anilist.co/manga/30013/One-Piece/), despite the fact that he has never included himself in any issue of the manga (excluding SBS).
- He voiced the character ["Odacchi" (オダッチ)](https://anilist.co/character/12281/Eiichirou-Oda) in a [soccer-themed short](https://anilist.co/anime/2386/ONE-PIECE-Yume-no-Soccer-Ou/) that aired with the [3rd One Piece Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/461/One-Piece-Choppers-Kingdom-on-the-Island-of-Strange-Animals/). "Odacchi" is Oda's nickname, and he played soccer when he was younger.
- Oda is a fan of rapper Eminem, filmmaker Quentin Tarantino and [Tim Burton](https://anilist.co/staff/323667/Timothy-Walter-Burton).
- Oda's 3 favorite movies are Seven Samurai, The Nightmare Before Christmas, and Young Guns.
- According to Oda in an interview for US Shonen Jump, his favorite villain in One Piece is [Buggy the Clown](https://anilist.co/character/725/Buggy) (he joked that he literally threw him together).

He is an art director and supervisor, who was a long time member of Bihou until 2007 when he went to head the background art department in Totonyan. He belongs to the anime production group Neko-Nanban-Tei together with director Watanabe Takashi and his wife Miyata Naomi.

node.description:
[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCln9P4Qm3-EAY4aiEPmRwEA) | [NicoNico](http://nicovideo.jp/mylist/58569901) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ado1024imokenp) | [Official Site (Universal Music Japan)](https://www.universal-music.co.jp/ado/)

Ado is a Japanese singer, composer and producer.

In 2014, Ado took an interest in music after a software of the video-sharing website Niconico was released on Nintendo 3DS. She began watching videos on the small screen of Nintendo 3DS, and was impressed by the cover singers on Niconico, who sang without showing their faces. Years later in 2017, Ado began singing as an utaite on Niconico, after uploading a video of herself singing a cover of "Kimi no taion".

On October 23, 2020, the day before her 18th birthday, she made her debut with the digital single titled "Usseewa". The song peaked at number 1 on Billboard Japan Hot 100, Oricon Digital Singles Chart, and the Oricon Streaming Chart. The music video of the song on her YouTube channel reached 100 million views in 148 days after its release. Reaching 100 million plays on Billboard Japan after 17 weeks from charting-in was the sixth fastest in history and the youngest for a solo singer. She currently belongs to the artist management company Cloud Nine.

On June 11, 2021, she was chosen as the second Japanese female Artist for "YouTube's Artist on the Rise".

On January 26, 2022, she released Kyougen (狂言), her first album.

On June 26, 2024, the J-Pop music group produced by Ado, Phantom Siita (ファントムシータ) debuted.

On July 10, 2024, she released Zanmu (残夢), her second album.

A Japanese musician, DJ, record producer, songwriter, composer, and arranger. He formed the band [capsule](https://anilist.co/staff/107506/) in 1997, and the band debuted in 2001 with the song "Sakura." He is also known for being the music producer for the Japanese girl group [Perfume](https://anilist.co/staff/158112/) and [Kyary Pamyu Pamyu](https://anilist.co/staff/118684/).

A Japanese musician, DJ, record producer, songwriter, composer, and arranger. He formed the band [capsule](https://anilist.co/staff/107506/) in 1997, and the band debuted in 2001 with the song "Sakura." He is also known for being the music producer for the Japanese girl group [Perfume](https://anilist.co/staff/158112/) and [Kyary Pamyu Pamyu](https://anilist.co/staff/118684/).

[Website](http://www.sawanohiroyuki.com/) | [Website (nZk)](http://www.sh-nzk.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sawano_nZk) | [Instagram (Official)](https://www.instagram.com/hiroyukisawano.official/) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/sawano__hiroyuki/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SawanoHiroyukiSMEJ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0Riv2KnFcLZA3JSVryRg4y?si=KaE_XDXqSRewfXXsxBNzoA) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/hiroyuki-sawano/156620523) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/1315147) 

Composer and musician represented by VV-ALKLINE since 2017. He was previously with Legendoor from 2006 to 2017. 
Sawano began practicing the piano at an early age, and studied composition, arrangement, orchestration, and piano under Nobuchika Tsuboi from the age of 17.

Active as a composer since 2004, he first gained recognition for his work on the Team Medical Dragon TV drama in 2006. He made his debut as an anime composer in 2006 on [Soul Link](https://anilist.co/anime/854/). In 2009, he released his first solo album *musica*, which included some of his more popular songs done for TV shows. In 2014, he launched a new vocal song project under the name "SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]", producing the first album *UnChild* with [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859/) as the vocalist under the name SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]:Aimer. Since then his songs under this vocal song project have also been used as the opening and ending themes for various anime.

He has cited [Joe Hisaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/100738/), [Youko Kanno](https://anilist.co/staff/95508/), [Hans Zimmer](https://anilist.co/staff/104669/) and Danny Elfman as major inspirations.

Non-anime role:

• **Xenoblade Chronicles X (music)** 
• **Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition (music)**

A Japanese musician, DJ, record producer, songwriter, composer, and arranger. He formed the band [capsule](https://anilist.co/staff/107506/) in 1997, and the band debuted in 2001 with the song "Sakura." He is also known for being the music producer for the Japanese girl group [Perfume](https://anilist.co/staff/158112/) and [Kyary Pamyu Pamyu](https://anilist.co/staff/118684/).

[Website](https://vaundy.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/vaundy_engawa) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/vaundy_engawa/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1FQWQ3y3-e8l1pCtWhJt5A)

Vaundy is a Japanese multi-talented artist who writes, composes and arranges music all by himself, his talents also expand to direction and self-production of designs and music videos.

Since his first music video posted on YouTube in spring of 2019, his songs “Tokyo Flash” and “Fukakouryoku” have since become social media sensations.
